description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows IP Routing Management Snap-in remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-38116), follow these steps:

1. Identify your Windows version and corresponding build number from the list below to determine the right update:
   - Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.26100.1457
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22631.4037
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22621.4037
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22000.3147
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.19045.4780
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.19044.4780
2. Visit the Microsoft Update Catalog and download the relevant KB update:
   - [KB5041571](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041571)
   - [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)
   - [KB5041580](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)
   - [KB5041782](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041782)
3. Install the downloaded update on your system.
4. Restart your computer to ensure the updates take effect.

**Details**:
This update addresses a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability that could potentially allow remote code execution. It is recommended to regularly check for updates to maintain security.

**Preconditions**:
- Verify the system architecture to choose the correct update package.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
